page.title: 01Farm & Heath Land Mid Sussex
page.content: Blocks main feature is East-West greensand ridge about 650-70m. above sea level, falling gently to South and more steeply to North. Land cover mostly agricultural grassland, typical farm size 50-100 ha with significant scattered woodland, but also about 160ha. of heathland known as the Chailey Commons, a local nature reserve and Site of Special Scientific interest freely accessible to the public. Some market gardening on the greensand. Block includes residential area of North Chailey, mainly small and medium sized houses (come Council houses). Elsewhre scattered larger houses, often 'gentrified' farmhouses. People usually work in neighbouring towns, with some commuting farther to Brighton, Crawley, Gatwick or London. A notable feature in Squares 4 & 7 is the three Chailey Heritage schools
